content.question: Assume that for consumers, pears and apples are substitutes. It is announced that pesticides used on most apples may be dangerous to consumersâ€™ health. As a result of this announcement, which of the following market changes is most likely to occur in the short run in the pear market?

choices.label: Choice A shows a graph in the first quadrant with price on the vertical axis and quantity of pears on the horizontal axis. Choice A has two parallel lines that increase linearly from the lower left with the upper line labeled supply sub 2 and the lower line labeled supply sub 1, and an arrow pointing up and to the left from supply sub 1 to supply sub 2. There are also two more parallel lines that decrease linearly from the upper left with the upper line labeled demand sub 2 and the lower line labeled demand sub 1, and an arrow pointing up and to the right from demand sub 1 to demand sub 2.

Choice B shows a graph in the first quadrant with price on the vertical axis and quantity of pears on the horizontal axis. Choice B has two parallel lines that increase linearly from the lower left with the upper line labeled supply sub 1 and the lower line labeled supply sub 2, and an arrow pointing down and to the right from supply sub 1 to supply sub 2. There is also a line that decreases linearly from the upper left labeled demand.

Choice C shows a graph in the first quadrant with price on the vertical axis and quantity of pears on the horizontal axis. Choice C has two parallel lines that decrease linearly from the upper left with the upper line labeled demand sub 1 and the lower line labeled demand sub 2, and an arrow pointing down and to the left from demand sub 1 to demand sub 2. There is also a line that increases linearly from the lower left labeled supply.

Choice D shows a graph in the first quadrant with price on the vertical axis and quantity of pears on the horizontal axis. Choice D has two parallel lines that decrease linearly from the upper left with the upper line labeled demand sub 2 and the lower line labeled demand sub 1, and an arrow pointing up and to the right from demand sub 1 to demand sub 2. There is also a line that increases linearly from the lower left labeled supply.

Choice E shows a graph in the first quadrant with price on the vertical axis and quantity of pears on the horizontal axis. Choice E has two parallel lines that decrease linearly from the upper left with the upper line labeled demand sub 1 and the lower line labeled demand sub 2, and an arrow pointing down and to the left from demand sub 1 to demand sub 2. There is also a vertical line in the center of the graph labeled supply.

content.answer: Choice D shows a graph in the first quadrant with price on the vertical axis and quantity of pears on the horizontal axis. Choice D has two parallel lines that decrease linearly from the upper left with the upper line labeled demand sub 2 and the lower line labeled demand sub 1, and an arrow pointing up and to the right from demand sub 1 to demand sub 2. There is also a line that increases linearly from the lower left labeled supply.
